text: James Richard Baxter (October 1, 1892 – July 26, 1961) was a minor league baseball player and an American football player and coach. ==Minor League Baseball== Baxter played for the Toledo Mud Hens of the Southern Michigan League in 1914 and later the American Association in 1927. He also played for the Jackson Vets and Flint Vehicles of the Southern Michigan League in 1915. ==College football coach== Baxter served as the head football coach at University of Toledo for a lone season in 1918, compiling a record of 1–1. ==Professional football== Baxter played for two season in the National Football League (NFL), first for the Racine Legion in 1923 and later for the Kenosha Maroons in 1924. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1892 births Category:1961 deaths Category:American football quarterbacks Category:American football defensive backs Category:Racine Legion players Category:Kenosha Maroons players Category:Flint Vehicles players Category:Jackson Vets players Category:Toledo Maroons players Category:Toledo Mud Hens players Category:Toledo Rockets football coaches Category:Kenyon College alumni Category:Sportspeople from Toledo, Ohio Category:Players of American football from Ohio
title: James Baxter (American football)
